DOC.brief_summary: This clinical study iobitridol patient undergoing multislice CT ( MSCT ) abdominal angiography .
DOC.brief_title: A Clinical Study Iobitridol Patients Undergoing Multislice Computed Tomography ( CT ) Abdominal Angiography
DOC.criteria: Male female reach legal majority age 85 year include . Scheduled aorta abdominal arterial tree evaluation MSCT , either pretherapeutic evaluation postsurgical control followup ( include patient prosthetic vascular material ) . Female childbearing potential must effective contraception ( contraceptive pill intrauterine device ) , surgically sterilise , postmenopausal ( minimum 12 month amenorrhea ) must document negative urine and/or blood pregnancy test screening . Patients overt noncompensated heart failure . Patients hemodynamic instability . Patients ESC ( European Society Cardiology ) /ESH ( European Society Hypertension ) grade 3 hypertension ( SBP [ systolic blood pressure ) equal 180 mm Hg DBP [ diastolic blood pressure ] equal 110 mm Hg ) Patients know severe renal failure ( defined creatinine clearance < 30 ml/min calculate Cockroft Gault formula ) . Patients receive diuretic biguanide treatment 48 hour precede MSCT scan . Patients know thyreotoxicosis . Patients history immediate delay major hypersensitivity reaction iodinate contrast medium .
